chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael L. Radke was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences Mr. Radke to 4 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years, consecutive to any sentence in being.

The Court STAYS this Sentence and places Mr. Radke on Probation for three years, with conditions (which will become conditions of Extended Supervision if Probation is revoked, with the exception of the conditional jail term).

--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--6 demerit points assessed
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period

--County alcohol and drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance [if Mr. Radke provides verification of attendance at the recent Jefferson County Victim Impact Panel, the Court will deem this requirement satisfied.]

miscConds.notes: --to pay fine of $4500 plus costs = $6398, plus $250 DNA surcharge
--to reimburse the Jefferson County Police Department for $127 in officer overtime costs

--upon release from incarceration, to be on SCRAM Program monitoring for 90 days
--to participate in the Jefferson County Alcohol Treatment Court
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and the approval of the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision
--to undergo AODA counseling and follow through with treatment recommendations

Arresting Agency:  Jefferson Police Department

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes:
FORTHWITH
--With Work Release privileges

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

records.addlTxt: of the Plea and Sentencing Hearing held before the Honorable Neal Nettesheim on October 3, 2014

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV: 
cases #14CF144 and #14CT284 called at 10:40am. [MK]
Defendant Michael L. Radke in court with Attorney Yelena O. Zarwell.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Attorney Zarwell orally Motions for the Court to Revoke Bond, so that the surety may receive the $2000 bail refund. Attorney Zarwell cites as bases for the Motion that the cash was posted by third-parties, and there is financial hardship involved.
ADA Shock argues in opposition to the Motion. 
The Court grants the Motion; the Court will allow the cash bond that was posted to be returned to the Surety. 

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #1 in Case #14CF144; factual basis stipulated including as to the dates of the prior convictions; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Radke guilty of Count #1, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 & #3, and also Case #14CT284.

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Radke to 4 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years, consecutive to any sentence in being.
The Court finds that Mr. Radke is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Radke is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 3 days credit for time already served.

The Court STAYS this Sentence and places Mr. Radke on Probation for three years, with conditions (which will become conditions of Extended Supervision if Probation is revoked, with the exception of the conditional jail term):
--to serve 120 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence forthwith
--upon release from incarceration, to be on SCRAM Program monitoring for 90 days
--to participate in the Jefferson County Alcohol Treatment Court
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and the approval of the Agent
--to pay fine of $4500 plus costs = $6398, plus $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay blood testing costs of $56.74
--to reimburse the Jefferson County Police Department for  $127 in officer overtime costs
--to comply with DNA sample provision
--to undergo AODA counseling and follow through with treatment recommendations

The Court orders outright:  
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--County alcohol and drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance [if Mr. Radke provides verification of attendance at the recent Jefferson County Victim Impact Panel, the Court will deem this requirement satisfied.] 
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed

Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 11:15am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 3, 2014 at 10:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Case called at 10:32 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Michael L. Radke in court with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Zarwell requests this matter be set for plea/sentencing on 9/26/14
DA Happ: No objection, presents concerns on delay
Atty Zarwell presents basis for delay
Court confirms address on file is accurate for Mr. Radke

NEXT: (1) Schedule Plea/Sentencing 9/26/14 at 10:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on August 29, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 6, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Case called at 8:44 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Michael L. Radke in court with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited.
Plea of "not guilty" entered

On Defendant's Motion to Modify bond:
Arguments presented by Counsel
Court presents basis and denies motion to modify bond & continues as previously set
Recess: 8:54 am 

NEXT: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 8/6/14 at 11:00 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 8/29/14 at 10:00 am - Send notices

Case called at 8:48 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Michael L. Radke in court with Attorney Yelena O Zarwell. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Radke waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information
Atty Zarwell requests arraignment be held at later date
Service of the Information Admitted; Reading Waived; Maximum penalties recited
Court continues bond

NEXT: (1) Arraignment scheduled for 7/18/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Preliminary hearing on June 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Case called at 1:59 pm
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Michael L. Radke in court with Attorney Yelena O Zarwell. DA Susan V Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Zarwell: Requests matter be set for preliminary hearing
Court continues bond

NEXT: (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 6/20/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on May 29, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 14, 2014 at 01:20 pm.
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.

Case called at 2:23 pm
Defendant Michael L. Radke in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Zarwell informs the Court that they have not received a copy of the criminal complaint
recess: 2:24 pm to allow time for the criminal complaint to be faxed to Jefferson County Jail.
reconvene 2:43 pm

Attorney Zarwell informs the Court that the defendant does not qualify for SPD representation.
Court reviews conflict review worksheet, Court finds no conflict and signs the conflict review worksheet.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Count #1 & #2.
Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint presents bail/bond recomendation.
The Court is informed that the defendant would like to address bond.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Court reviews right to counsel. Mr. Radke waives this right; Court finds this waiver to be made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently accepts this waiver and finds him competent to represent himself on the issue of bail.

Court requires $2,000.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-Defendant must appear at the 5/14/14 PTC at 1:20pm
-Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services. Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. Defendant to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on the first Monday or Thursday whichever day is immediately following release from custody at 1:30 pm.

Court finds that the waiver of the Preliminary time Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Recess: 3:08 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 5/14/14 at 1:20 pm 
Status: 5/29/14 at 2:00 pm
